text: Taiwan has one of the highest densities of mountains in the world.
The Tropic of Cancer runs right through Taiwan.
Taroko Gorge is one of the world’s deepest marble canyons.
Taiwan is the birthplace of bubble tea (invented in Taichung in the 1980s).
The world’s largest night market is in Taiwan (Fengjia Night Market).

Pineapple cakes were originally made with winter melon, not pineapple. Pineapple was added later to symbolize prosperity, as the word for pineapple (“旺來” ong-lai) sounds like “prosperity comes” in Taiwanese.
Bubble tea was invented in Taiwan in the 1980s, but no one agrees on who made it first—two different tea shops in Taichung both claim to be the original creator.
Taiwanese people celebrate Ghost Month in the 7th lunar month.
Betel nut chewing is a cultural phenomenon in some regions.
Taiwan has one of the highest densities of temples in the world.
Taiwan was under Japanese rule for 50 years (1895–1945).
It was the first country in Asia to legalize same-sex marriage (2019).
Taiwan is home to TSMC, the world’s top chip manufacturer.
The first modern high-speed rail system in Asia (after Japan) was launched in Taiwan.
7-Eleven stores in Taiwan offer bill payment, delivery, even dry cleaning.
Taiwan has a Hello Kitty-themed airplane and airport terminal.
